Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Depict \De*pict"\ (d[-e]*p[i^]kt"), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Depicted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Depicting}.] 1. To form a colored likeness of; to represent by a picture; to paint; to portray. [1913 Webster]
His arms are fairly depicted in his chamber. --Fuller. [1913 Webster]
2. To represent in words; to describe vividly. [1913 Webster]
C[ae]sar's gout was then depicted in energetic language. --Motley. [1913 Webster]
depicting n : a representation by picture or portraiture [syn: {depiction}, {portraying}, {portrayal}]
